Detailed Description

Packet that is sent as a reply to a GfxFeatureMapRequestPacket.

After the normal header this packet contains: Table begins at REPLY_HEADER_SIZE {tabular}{lll} Pos & Size & \ 0 & 1 bytes & Flags \ 0:5 & 1 bit & Bit set to 1 if the contents of the overview maps should be drawn in the following requests.\ 1 & 3 bytes & Unused. \ 4 & 4 bytes & MapID \ 8 & 4 bytes & Number of requests (i) that need to be resent 12 & 2 bytes & Length of copyright string\ 14 & string & The Copyright \ xxx & 4 bytes & i instances of the map ids of the requests to resend \ xxx & 4 bytes & i instances of bools about including the country polygon or not for each map id of the requests to resend \ xxx & 4 bytes & Number of bytes of the GfxFeatureMap data \ xxx & xxx & The GfxFeatureMap data {tabular}

Note that the number of requests to resend can be 0, and it is only in that case that we will find more than 0 bytes of GfxFeatureMap data in the reply.

When creating the replypacket, these methods must be called in the following order: setCopyRight() (optional) addMapIDforResending() (optional) addNbrFeaturesInNextLayer() (optional) setGfxFeatureMapData() (optional)

Member Function Documentation

void GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::addMapIDForResending (  uint32  mapID,
bool  includeCountryPolygon = true
)  [private]
 

Add a map id of a request that needs to be resent to the mapmodule.

This implies that the GfxFeatureMap is not yet extracted, ie. that the GfxFeatureMap data contains 0 bytes. { { NB!} Note that this method must not be called after setGfxFeatureMapData() or addNbrFeaturesInNextLayer().}

Parameters:
mapID The map id.
includeCountryPolygon If the country polygon should be included from this map (if country map). Default true.

const char* GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getCopyright (   )  const
 

Get the copyright string for the map data.

Returns:
The copyright string for the map data.

bool GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getDrawOverviewContents (   )  const
 

Returns true if the contents of the overview maps should be drawn.

Returns:
True if more than the LAND should be drawn in the country/overview maps.

DataBuffer* GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getGfxFeatureMapData (   ) 
 

Get the GfxFeatureMap as an unzipped DataBuffer.

{ { NB!} The DataBuffer returned by this method is created in this method but { must} be deleted by the caller!}

Returns:
A DataBuffer containing the requested GfxFeatureMap. Please note that the DataBuffer is created inside this method and must be deleted by the caller. Also note that the buffer is pointing into the packet, so the packet must not be deleted during the lifetime of the DataBuffer.

DataBuffer* GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getGfxFeatureMapData (  bool &  zipped  ) 
 

Get the GfxFeatureMap as a zipped or unzipped DataBuffer, as indicated by the zipped outparamter.

Returns:
A DataBuffer containing the requested GfxFeatureMap. Please note that the DataBuffer is created inside this method and must be deleted by the caller. Also note that the buffer is pointing into the packet, so the packet must not be deleted during the lifetime of the DataBuffer.

Returns:
The start position for the gfxData.

bool GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getIncludeCountryPolygonForMapToResend (  uint32  i  )  const [private]
 

Get info about country polygons should be included for the map id of the request to resend.

Parameters:
i The index of the request to resend. Note that the index must be less than getNbrRequestsToResend().
Returns:
Whether the country polygon should be included for the map id of request i to resend. False if the index i was invalid.

uint32 GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getMapID (   )  const
 

Gets the mapID of the packet.

This is the single mapID of the Packet if getNbrRequestsToResend is zero (0).

uint32 GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getMapIDToResend (  uint32  i  )  const [private]
 

Get the map id for a the request to resend.

Parameters:
i The index of the request to resend. Note that the index must be less than getNbrRequestsToResend().
Returns:
The map id for request i to resend. MAX_UINT32 if the index i was invalid.

uint32 GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::getNbrRequestsToResend (   )  const [inline, private]
 

Get the number of requests that need to be resent.

Returns:
The nbr of request to resend.

void GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::setDrawOverviewContents (  bool  drawOverview  )

void GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::setGfxFeatureMapData (  uint32  size,
DataBuffer *  data,
bool  zipped = false
) 
 

Set the GfxFeatureMap to the reply.

{ { NB!} Note that this method must not be called before addMapIDForResending() or addNbrFeaturesInNextLayer.} It does not make any sense to add a non empty GfxFeatureMap if there are requests to resend, since the GfxFeatureMap is not extracted yet at that time.

Parameters:
size The number of bytes of the GfxFeatureMap data.
buf Databuffer containing the GfxFeatureMap data.

void GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::setIncludeCountryPolygon (  bool  includeCountryPolygon  ) 
 

Set if the country polygon should be included/drawn.

Parameters:
includeCountryPolygon If true, the country polygon from this country map should be included/drawn.

void GfxFeatureMapReplyPacket::setMapID (  uint32  mapID  ) 
 

Sets the mapID of the packet.

This is the single mapID of the Packet if getNbrRequestsToResend is zero (0).
